{{also|Gewinnen}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|gewinnen}}, {{m|gmh|winnen}}, from {{inh|de|goh|winnan}}, {{m|goh|giwinnan}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*winnaną}}, ultimately from {{der|de|ine-pro|*wenh₁-||to strive, wish, desire, love}}. Cognate with {{cog|nl|winnen}}, {{cog|nds|winnen}}, {{cog|ang|ġewinnan}}, {{m|ang|winnan}} (whence {{cog|en|win}}), {{cog|no|vinne}}, {{cog|sv|vinna}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ɡəˈvɪnən/|[ɡəˈvɪ-]|[ɡəˈʋɪ-]|[-nən]|[-nn̩]}} * {{audio|de|De-gewinnen.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-gewinnen.ogg|audio (Austria)}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-strong|class=3|gewinnt|gewann|gewonnen|past subjunctive=[[gewänne]] or [[gewönne]]}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[win]]; to be [[victorious]] # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[win]] something; to [[gain]] # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[win over]]; to [[persuade]] # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[win]] or [[extract]] a resource ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-strong|gewinn|gewann|gewonnen|h|||gewänn|a}} ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|be victorious}} {{l|de|[[Gewinner]] [[sein]]}}; {{l|de|siegen}}; {{l|de|[[Sieger]] sein/[[bleiben]]}}; {{l|de|[[siegreich]] sein/bleiben}} * {{sense|gain}} {{l|de|einnehmen}}; {{l|de|erlangen}}; {{l|de|erreichen}}; {{l|de|[[für]] [[sich]] [[beanspruchen]] ([[können]])}}; {{l|de|in Beschlag nehmen}} * {{sense|persuade}} {{l|de|überzeugen}}; {{l|de|auf seine Seite ziehen}} * {{sense|extract}} {{l|de|abbauen}}; {{l|de|fördern}} ====Antonyms==== * {{sense|be victorious}} {{l|de|verlieren}} * {{sense|gain}} {{l|de|verlieren}} * {{sense|win over}} {{l|de|verlieren}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Gewinn}} * {{l|de|gewinnend}} * {{l|de|Gewinner}} * {{l|de|Gewinnung}} * {{l|de|wiedergewinnen}} * {{l|de|zurückgewinnen}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Luxembourgish== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|lb|gmh|gewenen}}, from {{inh|lb|goh|giwennen}}. Cognate with {{cog|de|gewöhnen}}, {{cog|nl|gewennen}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|lb|/ɡeˈvinen/|[ɡəˈvinən]}} ===Verb=== {{lb-verb||gewinnt}} # {{lb|lb|transitive|with preposition {{l|lb|un}}}} to [[get used to]], to become [[accustomed]] to ====Conjugation==== {{lb-conj-regular|gewinn|gewinnt|hunn}} ---- ==Middle Dutch== ===Etymology=== From {{prefix|dum|ge|winnen}}. ===Verb=== {{head|dum|verb}} # to [[win]], [[obtain]], [[acquire]] ====Inflection==== {{dum-conj-st|class=3|gewinn|gewan|gewonn|wonn}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:VMNW|ID61323|ghewinnen|II}} * {{R:MNW|13963}}
